programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 6, episode 32:

Spotlight on "Gems", the exhibition at the Muséum National d'Histoire Naturelle in Paris. All you ever wanted to know about the scrunchie. In Cholet, Équ'inox Exclusive is a flagship of the region's metalwork industry. How to wear a fishnet dress. Portrait of the ceramist Caroline Petit-Mason, founder of Three Seven.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: A sweet experience for Curieux Christian visits Anicet Desrochers in Ferme-Neuve, an internationally-renowned beekeeper. We discover all the honey varieties, used from starters through to desserts thanks to the talented chef Charles-Antoine Crête. Presenter: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: La vigne est belle
programme.desc:
Cultivating friendships
Biodynamic farming is increasingly common among Québec's winegrowers. How do you maximise the yield while also respecting the environment? This is their challenge! While some use their chickens to fight insects, others are diversifying their planting programmes to enrich the soil.
Director: Pascal Brouard (Canada, 2022)

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: Corsica's East Coast Between Bastia and Porto-Vecchio on Corsica's east coast, we meet Mathieu who grows clementines, a winter fruit packed with vitamins, Antoine and Siham Orsoni give us a taste of brocciu, a local cheese, and Marie Garrido explains why it's so important to save the Isle of Beauty's wetlands. Presenter: Guy Martin.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les nouveaux nomades
programme.desc: Taking a trip along the Loire estuary, discovering the elaborate art of braid and trimmings for soft furnishings, visiting the oldest canoe-kayak training centre coaching future champions for both flatwater and white water competitions, tracking down the world's oldest colour photo and its inventor. Presented by: Julie Hattu, Yvan Hallouin, Marine Barnérias, Éric Perrin.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: PASSAGE À L'HEURE D'ÉTÉ
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Thalassa
programme.desc:
In Corsica, the Scandola Nature Reserve was threatened by its high visitor numbers, leading the authorities to take steps to protect this exceptional site. Twenty years ago we met the "water-diviners of the sea", inventing a means of collecting freshwater from submarine springs. A major challenge for an essential resource.
Presented by: Sabine Quindou.

programme.title: Mégastructures romaines en Gaule
programme.desc:
In the heart of ancient Lyon
In Antiquity, Lyon was the largest city in France. Between the end of the 1st century BC and the 2nd century AD, Lugdunum saw the creation of monuments fit for a capital, making it a veritable showcase for Rome. We visit the Sanctuary of the Three Gauls and the Fourvière Theatre.
Directed by: Stanislas Kraland (France, 2021)

programme.title: Ô la belle vie
programme.desc: Cucugnan, Roland's bread Welcome to Cucugnan, in the Aude, for a delightfully poetic journey rich in flavour. Sophie Jovillard is off to meet Roland Feuillas, a baker unlike any other, for whom, from grain to oven-fresh loaf, bread has become his raison d'être. Presented by: Sophie Jovillard.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: Going local In Paris, encounter with Masami Lavault, an urban cut-flower grower. To mark their twentieth anniversary, an in-depth look at the AMAPs, local associations supporting small-scale market-gardeners. Visiting the gardens of the Verzenay lighthouse, amidst the vineyards of Champagne. Four years after his visit, Stéphane returns to Dominique and Jean-François' garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: Mon plus beau village
programme.desc:
Crupet with Rodrigo Beenkens
Rodrigo arrives in the centre of Crupet by motorbike. His first visit: the Saint-Antoine Cave, one of the region's unmissable sites, as demonstrated by the number of visitors it attracts from far and wide each year.
Presented by: Rodrigo Beenkens.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La main à la pâte
programme.desc: Oysters from Lund Luc meets an oyster producer from Lund, in British Columbia, at the end of the Trans-Canada highway. Yves Perreault shows Luc his floating farm... Presenter: Luc Jean.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: The Verdon The Verdon, Alpes-de-Haute-Provence. A must-visit region where the spectacular gorges sparkle with turquoise water and lavender-growing and cattle farming bring their own special beauty to the wild and rugged landscape. But other more recent products, such as artisanal beers and chickpea flour, today enrich the more traditional local heritage. Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: Les boutons de Loïc Allio/Tendance vintage/Les bijoux
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Passe-moi les jumelles
programme.desc: Cartes blanches 2 The programme's directors and journalists have carte blanche to talk about their lockdown.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Savoury muffins and sweet muffins Caroline Dumas prepares two large batches of muffins ideal for filling the freezer: savoury with Cheddar cheese and sweet with berry fruit. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.desc:

Twenty years ago we met the "water-diviners of the sea", inventing a means of collecting freshwater from submarine springs. A major challenge for an essential resource.
Presented by: Sabine Quindou.
